caption: Very good place to grab a glass of wine and some dinner. I haven't been since the corvid but I'm sure the quality is the same.

This place is beyond excellent! Great personal service! Very clean! And the food is hand crafted and amazingly delicious! This is my first time writing a review because I hate writing reviews but I had to for this restaurant.

The mother and daughter team that run Crostino are incredibly friendly and take Covid precautions seriously! The food is on point and absolutely delicious, with service to match! I highly recommend dining out at this delicious Italian restaurant!

This place is amazing. If you want quality food and wonderful people to attend care to your food with a lot of love, then this is the place for you. Owned by a mother and daughter that take pride in their craft. Words can’t really describe how many this place is so go ahead and go try it. You’ll be amazed I guarantee it.
The most amazing restaurant: cuisine, staff, service, etc. All amazing. You feel like family

We had a terrific meal there this past weekend. The menu had enough variety to satisfy different tastes but not so many choices as to foster mediocrity. My family (three of us) each ordered very different entrees and we all left raving about how delicious it all was. Service was perfect and the pride that the owners have in the restaurant was very evident.  I will definitely return and highly recommend this if you're in the neighborhood.  My only advice to the owners is to improve the signage. We are from out of town and not familiar with the neighborhood. Even with the gps taking us directly to your front door, it was still difficult to find. Other than that, perfection.
Good wine, Good food! Bon Appetit

TERRIBLE. STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU DO NOT COME HERE. THESE ARE THE REASONS WHY: -Food was terrible. Pasta tasted like it came out of a can. Did not finish most of the dishes. Worst thing I ate was the gnocchi and everything and I mean everything was coated in oil. -Saturday night - dinner was 2 hours, only 3 tables occupied in the restaurant -Absurdly overpriced - probably the worst value in a decade of eating in DC; $198 for 2 people not including gratuity -Poor value - got 1/2 pasta portion that was charged $14 and regular portion is $21 -Groupon: gives them the ability to mark up the pricing  COCKTAILS: Aperol Spritz (very common drink in Italy) $13 -1st one: missing Prosecco (how is this possible? These are the ingredients: 2 oz Prosecco, 1 1/4 oz Aperol, Splash of Soda water, only 3 ingredients how do you miss 1????) -2nd one: had a fly in it -3rd one: too much Prosecco not enough Aperol -4th one: whatever at this point  APPETIZERS: POLIPO - $16.90 oven-roasted Spanish octopus | organic baby arugula *really tiny slices of octopus, chewy and completely drenched in oil  APPETIZER SPECIAL: SALSICCA with ONIONS over MASHED POTATOES - $17 *this was the best dish but again I don't understand why there is so much oil  PASTA: GNOCCHI $21.90 - for the 1/2 portion they charged $14...uh ok you're charging 2/3 of the regular price that's absurd ricotta cheese dumpling pasta | tomato sauce *smallest gnocchi I've ever seen - identical size and flavor of Chef Boyardee canned pasta mini O's  PASTA SPECIAL: TORTELLINI PASTA with SALMON with same Chef Boyardee tomato sauce - $26 *super fishy and weird with tomato sauce  SECONDI: IL MERCATO DEL PESCE - $32 fresh whole fish of the day | arugula salad | lemon olive oil *Branzino: about 4 large bones and again they love oil...completely coated in it; arugula salad also covered in olive oil  DESSERT: TIRAMISU - $10 (OMG what a ripoff it was so small!) *Gross, soggy, messy, some sort of disgusting berry sauce splattered on the plate. Yuck. Did not finish.  I can almost guarantee they will be out of business within a year.
Really?!?!?! The food was AMAZING! My escalipe came with the bone in. Was absolutely delicious.

Pretty good restaurant week menu, little bit of everything! The red sauce was amazing and can't go wrong topping Focaccia with melted cheese. Definitely good for sharing and want to go back to try more!
Nice space. Went for an event.
Ladies bar come post dinner time, upstairs.
Some of the best service in the area, excellent staff. Fantastic authentic Italian food.
Wonderful handmade pasta and Italian dishes. Extremely flavorful, great service, definitely a good choice if Italian is your thing!
Wonderful fresh made pasta! Service was good with nice variety of food & drink.
Small, intimate spot with delicious handmade pastas. Definitely going back again. I recommend the Fettuccine bolognese!
Fantastic owner and chef. Some of the best pasta dishes in DC!!
#happyhour #livemusic I attended queer happy hour upstairs at XX+ Management, Chef and Social Director are super friendly and attentive! Definitely feels like cheers! 🍷
Very good food and great service. Nice ambience but it can be a little chilly on a cold  day when seated next to a window.
This place was very nice.  Loved the  Swordfish..
(Translated by Google) #romantic #drinkoutside  (Original) #romantic #drinkoutside

A very unfortunate dining experience this evening. Apparently they wouldn’t take the gift card that my mother gave me for Christmas (because she knew I love this place). Not a good business decision but I’m sure there are other great Italian places in Washington. Not worth the aggregation.  Arrivederci Al Crostino.
There's a pool table and the drinks are flavorful. Music is nice and staff is also very friendly. Definitely a nice place to visit on a Friday or Saturday night.
Excellent food and service! Cozy environment. Highly Recommended!
Great atmosphere
Always Excellent! One of my favorite restaurants for authentic Italian food, drink, and desert! The upstairs lounge is an amazing too!
Dope vibe.
Great food and service. Hidden gem in Shaw!
Amazing food!! Second time coming to this place and the food and service is great everytime!
Seafood had sand in it and if they put any less champ in the mimosa it would be bottomless OJ. Won't be returning. Service was good.

A buddy of mine suggested we check out Al Crostino because he heard good things about it. I was visiting from Los Angeles, and him from Boston. It's a cute little place and definitely worth checking out if you're in the area and craving some delicious pasta. It was super dead for a Sunday evening. We were the only people in the restaurant, but it looked fairly business outside since it was a 3 day weekend. Nice and quiet evening, which I can't complain about. Large window at the front where we were sitting and it was nice to be able to people watch and see what was going on outside. I'm guessing the woman that greeted us was the owner.  We started with the Pcaccia Bianca (baked flat bread topped with fresh mozzarella and arugula, with truffle oil). It was fresh, warm, and cheesy. All 3 things are great when involving cheese. I also had the Rigatoni Alla Juliana (pasta, ground Italian pork sausage, onions, cream, and truffle oil). The pasta was absolutely fabulous. I couldn't get enough and was a bit bummed out when I had finished it. There's a whole lot of flavor in this plate of pasta. The pasta was cooked just right. It wasn't too soft or too hard. Each bite made my mouth water, and I wanted more. I was excited to dip the complimentary bread into the leftover sauce in the end. Can't waste that precious creamy sauce.  Service was fast and friendly. Average prices for an Italian restaurant. Not sure about parking in the area, but we took and Uber over from downtown.
Great food and great service!  One of my favorite Italian restaurants in DC and anywhere!

Tucked into a converted row house, Al Crostino is unassuming and delightful. We've been several times and always enjoy it - most recently we went on a Friday evening and it was busy but still had great service. We enjoyed a caprese appetizer, ravioli and whitefish entrees, and mousse for dessert. Everything was wonderfully fresh and delicious. We'll be back!
Amazing - food is incredible. Under under rated!  One of our favorite places in the city!
Not visiting again
Yum!!!
Checked it out for brunch using a Groupon. Service was excellent, food was delicious! We'll be back!

We got to hear about this restaurant through Groupon. The food was beyond amazing. From the starters through to the dessert, this place is just perfect. And the owner, Giuliana was a perfect blend of classy and knowledgeable. My husband and I couldn't recommend this place enough. We will definitely come back next time we are in Washington DC!! ❤️
Cool space for cool humans. Thanks for the initiative to host a safe space.
Great food
Lovely service and beautiful atmosphere! They really made my girl & I's 6 month anniversary special
The food is always delicious here. Fresh, seasonal offerings and good wine.
Sunday brunch choices were limited but food was excellent and so was the service.

If an Italian place can't even do pasta right, it's a deal breaker. The pasta was like the ones I can make at home from $0.99 grocery store dry noodle package. What's the point of coming here? Service was okay. Decoration was fresh. We came during brunch. There were not a lot of customers for a reason.
Amazing food
Portion sizes not worth the price. Food was very mediocre. Wish they had more variety on their menu.
Food is exceptional😁👍 I highly recommend!
Nice and intimate. Great food and service.
The food was very good.

Amazing is the best word to describe Al Crostino!  While the wait staff is wonderful, the owners are even more amazing!  During our first visit, Lina Ncolai (the daughter) visited with us extensively.  Last night it was the main chef, Juliana (the mom!).  She counseled us on great wine.  And then she told us of her specialties for the day -- both incredible.  And when I made a comment about my love for a certain vegetable, she brought some out from the kitchen and placed them on my pasta.  I was speechless, but pleased.  You'll enjoy the warm hospitality and the wonderful food!

We were here this past weekend for a birthday dinner. The setting and decor are very nice. The waiter we had was friendly, but not knowledgeable of the menu items and their contents. I had a less than stellar experience with one of the cooks that was near the front door about bringing water to the table. He told me he wouldn't bring water or menus to the table until everyone was here. Mind you they weren't very busy at this time at all. The food was decent. If you do go get the Meatballs for appetizers, and the Lamb chops for your main course. This should all be washed down with a bottle of prosecco.
Intimate, cozy
Great food

This may be the best Italian food I've found in Washington, DC. I almost don't want to do a great review of Al Crostino - because it seems to be a best-kept secret right now. I'd hate to see it get so popular that I can't get a table. :-)  The food is exceptional. The staff - including the chef who greets everyone in the restaurant - is pleasant and knowledgeable. All of the dishes we tried were amazing.  We can't wait to go back...
Tasty little Italian in trendy area of DC

Please don't eat here.  Not only was this the worst meal we had in DC, it was hands down the worst Italian food I have ever had.  The orecchiette was completely over cooked and mushy, not to mention that the entire dish looked like something a very inexperienced cook could make at home. While the pasta in the rigatoni dish was well cooked, it was drowned in oil, so there wasn't much to taste.  Aside from the food being terrible, the service was poor as well.   Save your money and cook an Italian meal at home

Incredible food and a very attentive staff. I took my friends and their 9 month old and everyone was so nice and accommodating. Some of the best grilled calamari I have ever eaten. The pasta was perfect. The lamb chops were expertly prepared. I cannot wait to return.

A wonderful hidden gem.  The owner is incredibly friendly and sweet.  Simple decor, incredibly friendly staff, and absolutely wonderful food.  It is elegant but not stuffy.  A great date night restaurant.  Some of the best Italian food I have had in DC.  I highly recommend.

Over rated.  Food is ok but not spectacular as I was led to believe by other posts.  Service was nice with the owner and chef making recommendations in between smoke breaks, what's up with that right out front.  In any case the neighborhood is up and coming so if you read between the lines don't walk to this restaurant.  Hard to find as the signage is small and nondiscript even for Uber and cab drivers  Overall food ok but spendy considering all the other factors.
This place was amazing! Food and staff were great and really cozy inside. Don't miss!

DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!  I have never had such a horrible dinning experience in my entire life. My friend made reservations for a large group of about 15 for 8:30pm. We arrived there at 8:40pm and were promptly seated. However, we soon found out that only 1 waiter would be taking our orders and it took him so long to explain the specials menu and he kept running downstairs that by the time he finally got all of our orders it was 9:30pm.  Then we notice that the table next to us had a basket of bread which we never received. We had to ask one of the waiters 3 times for bread (which they said was in the oven) and when they finally brought it out it was as cold as bricks. Finally around 10:15pm they start bringing out our food only too find out that the computer that they put the orders into had a glitch so it messed up all of our orders so they had to send in our orders all over again... so we got our food at basically 10:45pm!!! More than 2 hours after our reservation!!!  I take one bite and I hate it. I can tell the chef rushed to make it because the pasta was barely cooked and it lacked seasoning. I don't understand how you're an italian restaurant and get pasta wrong! All of my friends were also displeased with their meals. One of my friends tried to send her meal back and order another and the chef stormed upstairs and was extremely rude basically yelling at my friend reasons why she should like it. Mind you, it was my friend's 21st birthday but it would have been unacceptable to talk to ANY customer like that. We later come to find out that that chef was the owner... I also noticed that the table sitting next to us was also displeased. They were a table of four and only two of them got their entrees on time and the rest had to wait almost over 1 hour to get their food.  In conclusion, safe yourself the headache and avoid this place!

I usually only write a review unless a place is really good or really bad, and this place had terrible service. We came to here for my friend's birthday expecting great service based on the reviews and we did not receive that. First, We ordered our meals around 9pm. After sitting for about an 1h30 mins, we realized that our food was not at our table. We asked our server (who was very nice) what happened and he stated how there was a glitch in the computer and our meals were never sent to the kitchen. On top of this, service was slow, not bread on the table and watered down drinks. our server gave us appetizers on the house (which we pretty much argued for) and the portions were very small. Our food finally came around 11PM!!! YES 11PM. The birthday girl did not like the meal she ordered and asked to exchange it. THIS WAS WHEN THE DRAMA BEGAN! The chef walked in with the MOST HARSH and AGGRESSIVE attitude questioning what my friends did not like and etc. My friend ended up ordering something else and THE chef walked away with an even worst attitude. IT was the WORST EXPERIENCE EVER...HERE ARE PICS TO PROVE IT.
No place like it.

My experience there wasn't not good. But, before I say how, I will say that overall the people and service is friendly. The waiters were kind, and one in particular apologized for the inconvenience that we had. We waited for a long while before our food came (1.5 hours to be more concise), the food was sub-par at most, and the chef was rude to my friend who was celebrating their birthday. So overall, out experience wasn't good. I do believe this place has potential to do well, but it didn't work out well for us. Twas Disappointed.

my dinner date described it as "delicious, but unpretentious" and I have to agree. the dishes have clean, simple flavors that are a real treat.    service is friendly. check OpenTable for 1000 point reservations, which are frequently available.
Tasty menu at a family owned Italian restaurant. Great pasta specials on Tuesdays. Do yourself a favor and order a meat out fresh fish, you won't be disappointed
Food here was so good.  Small, intimate spot, but they do take good care of you there.   Everything was great.  And they have Italian beer!
Had some very good ravioli. Portions seem small and dinner doesn't come with a salad.

Went here while visiting for a friend's wedding, happen to be my birthday weekend so wanted Italian! Love that the chef herself Julianna comes out and ask how your meal is! The food is amazing and the restaurant is very intimate. The tiramusu is great too, but I'm biased! Lol
Great place to spend time with family. Food is delicious. The owners are very kind. It was like they invite us for a dinner. They have the best tiramisu ever.

Recently returning from Italy, I have enjoyed searching for authentically similar delicatesses. I have found few, Al Crostino takes the cake.  Family owned and beautifully operated, we enjoyed every minute of it. We sat at the chefs table, which was a blessing in disguise. Julian made ordering easy. Her recommendations and chefs preference were amazing. The love and time this family puts into their food and guest's experience is a direct reflection of the same I experienced while in Italy.  My favorite dish has been the Gorgonzola gnocchi, but you don't get that option in most places in the states so naturally this is the dish I ordered at Al Crostino. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!  This restaraunt gem is my new found love.
Amazing service

Coming from northern New Jersey and exposure to traditional italian pasta dishes, I don't believe there is a ton of good italian in the DC area, even at high-priced establishments that get good publicity. This small but comfortable kitchen makes quite wonderful, authentic pasta dishes that don't try to wow you with a hundred flavors going on...they trust the simple flavors of their ingredients and completely nail the rustic tastes they are presenting. I've only had the pastas, but they are fantastic with just the right size portions. I tell everyone I know to go here, and everyone I've brought has loved it.
Just like home... If u want to experience real Italian food and ambiance look no more!

The service really is like no other in the neighborhood. It's a comfortable place to eat with fantastic food. The weekday specials can't be beat. Once you've been you'll want to come back to try something new.
Great authentic Italian food. The proprietors are lovely and make you feel right at home.

We were referred to Al Crostino, run by a mother-daughter team, by it's sister restaurant. As soon as you walk through the door, you feel like you're entering someone's home.  They were very accommodating for my friend's birthday and allowed us to stay well after closing. About six people, including management, would check in on us to make sure we were doing well.  The food was a little disappointing, particularly the skewers, and there wasn't a wide selection to pick from. One of the owners came to the table to offer Parmesan cheese to those who ordered pasta dishes, but when I ask for some (I ordered a delicious chicken entree) I was told "oh no honey, we are Italian we don't mess with our food" and was instructed to place the Parmesan cheese on the side until she left, before I could add it to my food.  We found this to be really amusing--their sense of pride and commitment to being a truly Italian restaurant was charming. This is a great and convenient place to eat before hitting the party scene on U Street.

The mother and daughter who run Al Crostino are warm and welcoming. The pasta is fantastic and the gnocci is out of this world. The Barbera is my favorite. We've had several wonderful meals here -- both romantic evenings and family gatherings alike. Everyone leaves happy and satisfied. But shhh -- Al Crostino is one of the best kept secrets in town.
This mom and daughter combo knocks it out of the park! Wine selection is great, and the varying menu never disappoints!
Great neighborhood Italian; the new owner is a vast improvement.
